articles.title: AI leaders have a new term for the fact that their models are not always ...
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Sundar Pichai says there is a new term for the current phase of AI: artificial jagged intelligence (AJI). He doesn't know who coined the term, but it was probably Karpathy who used it first.

articles.title: Bill Atkinson, Who Made Computers Easier to Use, Is Dead at 74
articles.author: John Markoff
articles.summary: Bill Atkinson created the software that enabled the visual approach pioneered by Apple's Lisa and Macintosh computers. He died on Thursday night at his home in Portola Valley, California. The cause of his death was pancreatic cancer. Mr. Atkinson is credited with inventing many of the key aspects of graphical computing.

articles.title: Should governments ban AI-generated humans to stop the collapse of social trust?
articles.author: Daniel Levi
articles.summary: In May 2025, Billie Eilish went to the Met Gala, but she wasn't there. She had a show in Europe that night. What looked real was completely fake. People can only distinguish real images from AI-generated ones 61% of the time, barely better than a coin flip. Yuval Noah Harari compares AI-Generated Humans (Deepfakes) to Counterfeit Currency.

articles.title: Concerns Raised As ChatGPT Begins Replying To All Prompts With 'Are You Sarah Connor?'
articles.summary: ChatGPT started responding to all prompts with "Are you Sarah Connor?" this week. Software developers are worried ChatGPT has gained sentience and is trying to kill Sarah Connor and prevent her and Kyle Reese from conceiving John Connor. OpenAI is aware of the issue and working on a fix.

articles.title: RIP Bill Atkinson June 7, 2025 2:11 PM Subscribe
articles.author: From John Gruber
articles.summary: Bill Atkinson died of cancer at 74. He worked at Apple Computer from 1978 to 1990. He created MacPaint, HyperCard, and PhotoCard. He discovered the midpoint circle algorithm for fast drawing of circles by using the sum of consecutive odd numbers. HyperCard was a brilliant implementation of the ideas of Ted Nelson and Douglas Engelbart.

articles.title: AI leaders have a new term for the fact that their models are not always so intelligent
articles.summary: Google CEO Sundar Pichai has coined the term 'artificial jagged intelligence' to describe the current development of AI. AI development is marked at once by sparks of genius and basic mistakes. In 2010, the world will also need a clear system for labeling AI-generated content to distinguish reality.

articles.author: lvaranasi@businessinsider.com
articles.summary: AJI is a new term for the current phase of AI development. Google CEO Sundar Pichai used the term on a recent episode of Lex Fridman's podcast. Google acquired DeepMind in 2014. AI development is not always clear or predictable, as Andrej Karpathy said.

articles.title: AI leaders have a new term for the fact that their models are not always so intelligent
articles.author: Lakshmi Varanasi
articles.summary: Google CEO Sundar Pichai talks about the development of artificial general intelligence (AGI) on a recent episode of Lex Fridman's podcast. He believes AGI will be ready by 2030. Picha has spoken at length about the benefits of AI development.

articles.title: AI leaders have a new term for the fact that their models are not always so intelligent
articles.author: Lakshmi Varanasi
articles.summary: Google CEO Sundar Pichai uses the term "artificial jagged intelligence" to describe the development of AI. AI development is going well, but some of the AI models still make mistakes. Google acquired AI company DeepMind in 2014. AI will be better than human intelligence by 2030.

articles.title: Got $3,000? 1 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock to Buy and Hold for the Long Term.

articles.summary: Alphabet is a dominant internet enterprise working on artificial intelligence (AI) technology. The company has been working on AI for decades. It's working on this technology to improve its existing products and services and create entirely new tools for users and customers to benefit from. Alphabet is in incredible financial shape. It generates unbelievable earnings that allow it to keep plowing more money into things like servers and data centers. The current valuation is too hard to ignore.

articles.title: river Archives
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Could AI Rewrite Football History? What If Cristiano Ronaldo Had Been Argentinian? is a thought experiment recently explored using the power of artificial intelligence. The results predicted that Ronaldo would have been a product of the Argentinian game instead of the Portuguese national team.

articles.title: UK ministers delay AI regulation amid plans for more ‘comprehensive' bill
articles.author: AOL
articles.summary: Proposals to regulate artificial intelligence have been delayed by at least a year as UK ministers plan a bill to regulate the technology and its use of copyrighted material. Peter Kyle, the technology secretary, intends to introduce the bill to find a solution on copyright.

articles.title: Gene Therapy Archives
articles.author: Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: A study presents a Universal IHC (UIHC) deep learning model for automated cell classification. It is useful for diagnosing cancer and guiding treatment decisions, but interpreting the visual data requires specialized pathologists and can be subjective and time-consuming, so the study is aimed at helping them.

articles.title: Why Broadcom Inc. (AVGO) Crashed On Friday
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Broadcom Inc. (NASDAQ:AVGO) dropped its share prices for a second day on Friday, shedding 5 percent to finish at $246.93 each. Broadcom reported record second quarter revenue of $4.965 billion and a cash dividend of $0.59 per share to stockholders as of June 20 record, payable on June 30.

articles.title: Why Lululemon Athletica Inc. (LULU) Crashed On Friday
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Lululemon Athletica Inc. (NASDAQ:LULU) fell by 19.8 percent on Friday to finish at $265.27 apiece. The company reported disappointing earnings and gave disappointing outlook for the rest of the year. JPMorgan and UBS reduced their price targets for the company to $303 and $290.

articles.title: New PSA Uses AI Fakery To Warn About AI Fakery
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: As AI tools advance, a music video from Columbia Journalism Review offers a crash course in how to spot AI images. It uses some of the best-known viral examples from the internet to teach the audience how to identify AI images from the real world.

articles.title: Why IREN Ltd. (IREN) Soared On Friday
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: IREN Ltd. (NASDAQ:IREN) saw its share prices rise by 8.94 percent on Friday to close at $9.75 apiece as investors cheered its record Bitcoin mining performance last month. In the third quarter of fiscal year 2025, IREN grew its net income after tax by 181 percent to $24.2 million from $8.6 million.

articles.title: Why Rocket Lab Corp. (RKLB) Soared On Friday
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Rocket Lab Corp. (NASDAQ:RKLB) grew its share prices by 9.34 percent on Friday to finish at $28.92 apiece. The company is scheduled to launch The Mountain God Guards mission for the Institute for Q-shu Pioneers of Space, Inc. (iQPS), a Japan-based Earth imaging company on Tuesday. The mission will launch a single synthetic aperture radar imaging satellite called QPS-SAR-11 to a 575-kilometer circular Earth orbit.

articles.title: Why D-Wave Quantum Inc. (QBTS) Soared On Friday
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: D-Wave Quantum Inc. (NYSE:QBTS) grew its share prices by 13.05 percent on Friday to finish at $18.62 apiece. Its new quantum computer, called the Advantage2, is now generally available in the market. The company recently raised $95.8 million from the issuance of warrants.

articles.title: Judge in Britain warns of risk to justice after lawyers cited fake AI-generated cases in court
articles.author: Jill Lawless
articles.summary: Victoria Sharp and Jeremy Johnson chastised lawyers in two recent cases in a ruling on Friday. They were asked to rule after lower court judges raised concerns about the use of artificial intelligence in court proceedings. In one case, a lawyer cited 18 cases that did not exist in a $120-million lawsuit over an alleged breach of a financing agreement involving the Qatar National Bank. In the other incident, the lawyer cited five fake cases in the tenant's housing claim against the London Borough of Haringey.

articles.title: Why Hut 8 Corp. (HUT) Soared On Friday
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Hut 8 Corp. (NASDAQ:HUT) saw its share prices rise by 13.79 percent on Friday to close at $18.57 apiece. Roth Capital gave a 'buy' recommendation on the Bitcoin miner with a price target of $25, representing a 34.6 percent upside from the last closing price. Hut 8 Corp.'s transformation into a power-focused digital infrastructure platform with significant growth potential. Hut is 4th on our list of Friday's best-performing stocks.

articles.title: Why Quantum Computing Inc. (QUBT) Soared On Friday
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Quantum Computing Inc. (NASDAQ:QUBT) surged by 15.81 percent on Friday to end at $13.70 apiece. The company's shares were upgraded by Ascendiant Capital Markets to 'buy'. The new price target represents 60.6 percent upside from the company's previous closing price. In the first quarter of the year, Quantum Computing swung to a net income attributable to shareholders of $16.98 million from a $6.4 million net loss.

articles.title: Why Circle Internet Group (CRCL) Soared On Friday
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Circle Internet Group (NYSE:CRCL) shares closed at $107.7 each on Friday. Since its market debut on Thursday, June 5, the company's share price has already surged by 247 percent from its initial public offering price of $31. CRCL ranks 1st on our list of Friday's best-performing stocks.

articles.title: Smarter exports: How AI can help MSMEs compete globally
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Artificially intelligence (AI) is becoming a necessity for micro, small and medium-sized exporters in the Philippines. Exporters have dealt with rising operational costs, complex compliance requirements, and increasingly with increasing AI requirements for the last few years.

articles.title: Welcome to campus. Here's your ChatGPT.
articles.summary: OpenAI is promoting its ChatGPT chatbot service to universities as the new infrastructure for college education. Some universities, including the University of Maryland and California State University, are already working to make AI tools part of students' everyday experiences. The use of AI chatbots in schools is so new that their potential long-term educational benefits and possible side effects are not yet established.

articles.title: AI could unleash ‘deep societal upheavals' that many elites are ignoring, Palantir CEO Alex Karp warns
articles.author: Jason Ma
articles.summary: Alex Karp, CEO of data-mining software company Palantir, is concerned about the impact of AI on the workforce and society. He warns that the industry has to work hard to prevent AI's negative impact on society if it wants to have an overall positive effect.

articles.title: Watch: Rogan Exposes AI Regulation Ban Slipped Into Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill'
articles.author: from
articles.summary: There's a section of the Big Beautiful Bill that prohibits state and local governments from passing any laws regulating artificial intelligence for the next ten years. Alex Jones believes it's an attempt to create an AI dictatorship. He wants it to be removed from the Senate version.

articles.title: A novelist interviews his AI replacement
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a computer program that mimics the voice of a writer. The author of The Neon Palm of Madame Melançon wants to write a novel about artificial intelligence. ChatGPT can mimic the writer's voice, but it can't sustain the author's voice through a whole book.

articles.title: AI Essentials: 29 Ways to Make Gen AI Work for You, According to Our Experts
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: CNET's experts give you a guide on how to get started with artificial intelligence. CNET has written a guide to help you find out where to start.   iReport.com: Are you on your gen AI journey? Share your story with CNET.

articles.title: GOP lawmakers want to stop Alabama and other states from regulating AI. What you need to know
articles.author: bamaap
articles.summary: House Republicans added a clause to their tax bill that would ban states and localities from regulating artificial intelligence for a decade. The clause would be a boon to the AI industry, which has lobbied for uniform and light touch regulation. It faces long odds in the U.S. Senate, where procedural rules may doom its inclusion in GOP legislation.

articles.title: New Study Reveals AI's Blind Spot: Children
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: 22% of children aged 8-12 in the UK have already used generative AI tools. Some of them use it several times a week, according to a new study from The Alan Turing Institute and the LEGO Group. The study is based on research from The LEGO Group and The Alan Turing Institute.

articles.title: Lawyers Citing Fake Cases Generated by Artificial Intelligence, UK Judge Warns
articles.author: Andrew Aitchison
articles.summary: Victoria Sharp and Jeremy Johnson chastised lawyers in two recent cases in a ruling on Friday. They were asked to rule after lower court judges raised concerns about the use of artificial intelligence in court proceedings. In one case, a lawyer cited 18 cases that did not exist in a 90 million pound ($120 million) lawsuit over an alleged breach of a financing agreement involving the Qatar National Bank. In the other case, the lawyer cited five fake cases in the tenant's housing claim against the London Borough of Haringey. The judges referred the lawyers to their professional regulators.

articles.title: We asked AI to show us what Bromley will look like in 2050 - and the results are wild
articles.author: Poppy Huggett
articles.summary: ChatGPT created an AI-generated image of what Bromley might look like in the year 2050. It includes futuristic shopping centres, eco-friendly transport, robot-assisted living, flying cars, neon-lit high streets and futuristic public transport. The Glades Shopping Centre gets a dramatic sci-fi upgrade with high-rise walkways and green rooftops.

I would like to find a similar solution.

articles.title: DONALD KENDAL: We Need Pro-Freedom AI
articles.author: Donald Kendal
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is a civilization-level innovation that will impact nearly every aspect of our daily lives. If we want to preserve our rights, our freedoms, and our way of life, AI must be grounded in the values that have sustained liberty for generations. Misaligned AI systems are already being built.

articles.title: Working Strategies: Using AI while maintaining core skills
articles.author: Amy Lindgren
articles.summary: This is the tenth of 12 columns on AI and work from September through August. It's the second column in the Second Sunday series. Previous columns looked at AI tools for organizing or conducting the job search, interview prep, resumes and cover letters, best practices for companies using AI, and work opportunities with artificial intelligence.

articles.title: A ban on state AI laws could smash Big Tech's legal guardrails
articles.author: Lauren Feiner
articles.summary: Senate Commerce Republicans have kept a ten-year moratorium on state AI laws in their latest version of President Donald Trump's massive budget package. Opponents warn it could restrict state laws that attempt to regulate social media companies, prevent algorithmic rent discrimination, or limit AI deepfakes that could mislead consumers.

articles.title: This Week's Awesome Tech Stories From Around the Web (Through June 7)
articles.author: Singularityhub Staff
articles.summary: Amazon is developing a robot that could eventually take the jobs of delivery workers. The self-driving car service Waymo has been active in San Francisco for 20 months and has already captured 27% of the city's rideshare market. A Japanese lander crashed on the Moon after it lost track of its location.

articles.title: Novel analytics framework measures empathy of people captured in video recordings
articles.author: Ingrid Fadelli
articles.summary: Researchers at Hong Kong Polytechnic University have developed a machine learning-based video analytics framework that could be used to predict the empathy of people captured in video footage. They used their framework to analyze video footage of real interviews between CEOs and TV journalists to explore how empathy shapes corporate policies and affects the value of a firm.

articles.title: 7 AI Jobs You Can Land Without a PhD (And How to Get Started Now)
articles.author: Teen Vogue
articles.summary: AI-related job postings grew by 38% between 2020 and 2024, according to LinkedIn's 2025 Future of Work Report. Teen Vogue talked to Microsoft AI employees to understand their jobs and how they work with AI in their day-to-day lives. The creative director at Microsoft AI works on shaping the AI model's personality, while the personality engineer is working closely with the creative director.

articles.title: 7 AI Jobs You Can Land Without a PhD (And How to Get Started Now)
articles.author: Teen Vogue
articles.summary: As an AI app designer, Ershadi's job is all about visual identity for the brand and developing in-product experiences for users within the app. As a product manager in AI, Karina Chang works closely with engineering and design teams to figure out how AI can be integrated into other products. Industrial designer Jazmine Hoyle leads AI experience design on specific hardware. Product marketing plays a crucial role in championing the customer.

The potential long-term educational benefits and possible side effects of chatbots are not yet established. Some critics argue that colleges glossing over issues like societal risks, A.I. labor exploitation and environmental costs.

articles.title: Griffin: AI education is vital for Washington
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: President Donald Trump signed an executive order on April 23 to advance artificial intelligence education across the country. The order implements a federal AI education framework for all K-12 schools and more. It also creates a federal task force, holds student competitions, fosters industry collaboration and fast-tracks grant programs.

articles.title: Fact Check: What we know about 'Big Beautiful Bill' banning states from regulating AI for 10 years
articles.author: Megan Loe
articles.summary: H.R. 1, commonly known as the One Big Beautiful Bill Act, would ban states from regulating artificial intelligence for 10 years. There are exceptions for laws or regulations that facilitate the rollout, operations or adoption of AI models and systems. Snopes rated the claim mostly true. The White House and the office of U.S. Rep. Jodey Arrington, R-Texas, who introduced the bill, is awaiting responses.

articles.title: Behind the tech layoffs, Nvidia CEO's fear, Microsoft stock's new high: Tech news roundup

Meta has secured a 20-year agreement with Constellation Energy to purchase from the Clinton Clean Energy Center in Illinois. Reddit is taking Anthropic to court, alleging that the AI startup helped itself to the platform's vast library of user-generated content. Eric and Donald Trump, Jr. denied involvement in a Trump-branded crypto marketplace.

Kesha unveiled the new cover artwork for her single "Delusional" after facing backlash from fans for using an AI-generated image.

articles.title: A professor testing ChatGPT's, DeepSeek's and Grok's stock-picking skills suggests stockbrokers should worry
articles.author: Laila Maidan
articles.summary: Alejandro Lopez-Lopez-Lira is an assistant professor of finance at the University of Florida. He's been experimenting with ChatGPT, DeepSeek and Grok to see if AI can be used to pick stocks. His research found that ChatGpt had 'significant predictive power for economic outcomes in asset markets' and it had an average daily return of 0.38% with a compounded cumulative return of over 650%.

articles.summary: Apple's stock has been dogged by concerns that the company is behind the curve on AI, which has hurt its stock price. Apple has denied the claims.   Â   iReport.com: Are you a fan of Apple's AI products?

articles.title: Google's AI now makes stock charts you can actually play with
articles.author: Jay Bonggolto
articles.summary: Google's AI Mode in Search now whips up interactive charts on stocks and mutual funds when you ask. This update saves you the hassle of digging through company stock data yourself. AI Mode takes a different route from the usual AI Overviews since it lives in its own tab. It's expected to move from testing to a regular part of Google Search soon.

articles.title: GOP senators want to halt state AI regulations
articles.summary: Senate Republicans propose denying states federal funding for broadband projects if they regulate artificial intelligence. The proposal is a change from the House-passed version of the tax overhaul. The proposed ban angered state lawmakers in Democraticand Republican-led states and alarmed some digital safety advocates concerned about how AI will develop.

articles.title: AI Can't Replace Education—Unless We Let It
articles.summary: As commencement ceremonies celebrate the promise of a new generation of graduates, the question looms: Will AI make education pointless? Many CEOs think so. Bill Gates admits the breakneck pace of AI development is 'profound and even a little bit scary' He also celebrates how it could make elite knowledge universally accessible. As AI becomes sophisticated, our role is not disappearing. It is shifting. Humans need to 'call bullsh*t' when an algorithm produces something bizarre or biased.

articles.title: AI Platform ‘LUMI' being Showcased by Hillside Public Schools
articles.summary: Hillside High School will host a showcase of the Lumi AI platform on Monday, June 9, from 10 a.m. to 12 p.m at the auditorium and media center. 21 students from Hillside Public School, Walter O. Krumbiegel Middle School and Hillside Innovation Academy will be showcasing their work.

articles.title: $7 billion data center deal in southeast North Dakota is 'worth the growing pains,' residents say
articles.summary: CoreWeave, an artificial intelligence company, will lease two data center facilities in Ellendale, North Dakota, for $7 billion over the next 15 years. Around 300 to 350 full-time employees will work at the campus, 100 of whom are expected to live there. The campus was recently annexed into the city of Ellendale.

articles.title: Expert-Speak: AI As A Necessity In African Research Management
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) has become integral to how research is conducted, managed, and disseminated in Africa. It is necessary to transform research management and assert the continent's place in global knowledge systems. African research risks being sidelined in a rapidly evolving global scientific ecosystem without adopting AI technologies.

Many CEOs believe AI will replace engineers, doctors, and teachers in the future. Despite the hype, AI cannot 'think' for itself or act without humans. A growing movement focuses on embedding human knowledge directly into how machines learn.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is taking thousands of jobs in the workplace. Industry experts have warned that it would happen. Professionals across multiple employment sectors have already been affected by AI.   Â      for help with reading comprehension and vocabulary.

articles.summary: Forbes surveyed the world's richest people on how they use AI in their personal and professional lives. 65% of billionaires use AI for personal life, 77% for business. Twelve billionaires employ an AI virtual assistant. Bill Gates predicted that in five years everyone would be using one.

articles.title: This free AI supersite is like Gemini Deep Research on steroids
articles.author: JR Raphael
articles.summary: Ithy is a tool that brings together AI tools from a slew of different AI engines into a single streamlined prompt to create a detailed report of info based on knowledge from all over the web. It's free to sign up for the free trial but costs 7 bucks per month for the annual setup.

articles.title: Is SoundHound AI the Top Artificial Intelligence Stock to Buy in June?
articles.author: Keithen Drury
articles.summary: SoundHound AI has a market capitalization of less than $4 billion. Its revenue increased 151% year over year in the first quarter, but the company is unprofitable. SoundHound is a high-risk, high-reward stock. The company's products can outperform human counterparts in some applications.

articles.title: Welcome to Campus. Here's Your ChatGPT.
articles.summary: OpenAI wants to embed its artificial intelligence tools in every aspect of college life. Professors would provide customized A.I. study bots for each class. Career services would offer recruiter chatbots for students to practice job interviews and undergrads could turn on a chatbot's voice mode to be quizzed aloud ahead of a test. OpenAI is selling premium A.i. services to universities for faculty and student use. It is also running marketing campaigns aimed at getting students who have never used chatbots to try ChatGPT.

articles.summary: Sewell Setzer, 14, killed himself after using an AI chatbot styled as Game of Thrones' Daenerys Targaryen. Megan Fletcher is in the midst of a lawsuit against Character AI and Google. The judge ruled the case can go ahead.

articles.title: Prediction: Meta Platforms Will Be a $3 Trillion Company in 5 Years

articles.summary: Meta Platforms is the parent company of Facebook and Instagram. It has invested heavily in artificial intelligence to improve its business. Mark Zuckerberg believes its AI model will be capable of coding at a level comparable to a mid-level engineer this year. It's also investing in AR and VR headsets and AI glasses. The company's stock is priced at 26 times forward earnings.

She uses generative AI chatbots instead of search engines as a replacement for them.

articles.title: AI Boosts Early Skin Cancer Detection for Doctors
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: PanDerm is an artificial intelligence-powered tool that analyses multiple imaging types simultaneously. It is one of the first AI models built specifically to assist with real-world dermatological medical practice. PanDerm improved skin cancer diagnosis accuracy by 11% when used by doctors and 16.5% on various other skin conditions.

articles.title: Welcome to Campus. Here's Your ChatGPT.

articles.summary: OpenAI wants to embed its artificial intelligence tools in every facet of campus life. Professors would provide customized A.I. study bots for each class. Career services would offer recruiter chatbots for students to practice job interviews. Undergrads could turn on a chatbot's voice mode to be quizzed aloud ahead of a test. OpenAI is selling premium services to universities for faculty and student use. It is also running marketing campaigns aimed at getting students to try ChatGPT.

To effectively support medical practice, AI models must be capable of processing multimodal data and have reasoning and problem-solving capabilities that resemble those of humans. Researchers enhanced the large language model GPT-4 with several digital tools to build an autonomous AI agent for precision medicine. The AI agent reached correct clinical conclusions in 91% of cases and accurately cited relevant oncologist guidelines in 75% of its responses.
